Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as it falsely attributes the billboards to author Stephen King, when in fact, he had nothing to do with them.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Stephen King placed billboards targeting Senator Susan Collins outside his home, which is not true.
Exist alternative explanation: The billboards were actually part of a $400,000 ad campaign by progressive organizations targeting GOP senators in ongoing impeachment proceedings against President Donald Trump.
